contact.group: Centre for Ophthalmology and Visual Sciences, The University of Western Australia

publications.title: Generation of an induced pluripotent stem cell line from a patient with retinitis pigmentosa caused by RP1 mutation

donor.disease_description: Patient with autosomal dominant retinitis pigmentosa caused by a nonsense mutation in the RP1 gene (c.2098G>T, p.E700X); 76-year-old Caucasian female with delayed and reduced visual acuity and field, typical clinical features of RP.

genomic_modifications.description: Heterozygous nonsense mutation in RP1 gene (c.2098G>T, p.E700X)

genomic_characterisation.summary: Normal female karyotype at 0.5MB resolution; no chromosomal rearrangements detected.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: Episomal iPSC Reprogramming Plasmid kit (SC900A-1, System Biosciences)

ethics.institutional_HREC: University of Western Australia Human Research Ethics Committee
